SEARCH
Package com.app.service.impl

Class UserServiceImpl

java.lang.Object
com.app.service.impl.UserServiceImpl
All Implemented Interfaces:
UserService
@Service @Transactional public class UserServiceImpl extends Object implements UserService
Implementation of the UserService interface. This class handles the user management functionality, including user creation, activation, password change, role change, email change, and token management.

  • Method Details

    • init

      @PostConstruct public void init()
      Initializes the service by checking if the default admin user already exists. If it does not exist, the default admin user is created.
      Specified by:
      init in interface UserService

    • createUser

      public Long createUser(CreateUserDto createUserDto)
      Creates a new user.
      Specified by:
      createUser in interface UserService
      Parameters:
      createUserDto - the DTO containing the user creation data
      Returns:
      the ID of the created user
      Throws:
      ResourceAlreadyExistException - if the username or email already exists

    • activateUser

      public Long activateUser(UserTokenActivationDto userTokenActivationDto)
      Activates a user based on the provided token.
      Specified by:
      activateUser in interface UserService
      Parameters:
      userTokenActivationDto - the DTO containing the token for user activation
      Returns:
      the ID of the activated user
      Throws:
      jakarta.persistence.EntityNotFoundException - if the token is not found or invalid

    • refreshToken

      public Long refreshToken(UserEmailRefreshToken userEmailRefreshToken)
      Refreshes the activation token for a user based on their email.
      Specified by:
      refreshToken in interface UserService
      Parameters:
      userEmailRefreshToken - the DTO containing the user's email
      Returns:
      the ID of the user whose token is being refreshed
      Throws:
      jakarta.persistence.EntityNotFoundException - if the user is not found
      UserAlreadyActivatedException - if the user is already activated
      ResourceAlreadyExistException - if a token already exists

    • changePassword

      public Long changePassword(ChangePasswordDto changePasswordDto, String token)
      Changes the user's password.
      Specified by:
      changePassword in interface UserService
      Parameters:
      changePasswordDto - the DTO containing the new password data
      token - the token used to identify the user
      Returns:
      the ID of the user whose password was changed
      Throws:
      InvalidCredentialsException - if the current password does not match
      IllegalArgumentException - if the token is null
      jakarta.persistence.EntityNotFoundException - if the user is not found

    • changeRole

      public Long changeRole(ChangeRoleDto changeRoleDto)
      Changes the role of an existing user.
      Specified by:
      changeRole in interface UserService
      Parameters:
      changeRoleDto - the DTO containing the user ID and the new role
      Returns:
      the ID of the user whose role was changed
      Throws:
      jakarta.persistence.EntityNotFoundException - if the user is not found

    • lostPassword

      public Long lostPassword(EmailDto emailDto)
      Handles the case where a user has lost their password and requests a password reset.
      Specified by:
      lostPassword in interface UserService
      Parameters:
      emailDto - the DTO containing the user's email
      Returns:
      the ID of the user who requested a password reset
      Throws:
      jakarta.persistence.EntityNotFoundException - if the email is not found

    • newPassword

      public Long newPassword(NewPasswordDto newPasswordDto)
      Sets a new password for a user based on the provided token.
      Specified by:

      Parameters:
      newPasswordDto - the DTO containing the new password and token
      Returns:
      the ID of the user whose password was set
      Throws:
      jakarta.persistence.EntityNotFoundException - if the token is not found or invalid
